title: Currency
description: Represents a Metric or standard of value for measuring Money.

alphabeticCode.description: An alphabetic code that represents the currency, e.g., "EUR" for the Euro.
alphabeticCode.title: Currency.alphabeticCode Schema

definition.description: A description of the Currency, e.g., "The monetary unit of the United Kingdom".
definition.title: Currency.definition schema

numericCode.description: A numeric code optionally assigned to the Currency, e.g., the ISO 4217 standard assigns the numeric code "826" to the pound sterling (U.K.), and "840" to the U.S. dollar.
numericCode.title: Currency.numericCode

majorUnitSymbol.description: The symbol used to denote the major unit of the currency, e.g., in the U.K., the major unit is the pound "Â£".
majorUnitSymbol.title: Currency.majorUnitSymbol Schema

minorUnitSymbol.description: The symbol used to denote the minor unit of the currency, e.g., in the U.K., the minor unit is "pence," with the symbol "p". If the currency does not have a minor unit (e.g., the Turkish Lira), this attribute should have the value null.
minorUnitSymbol.title: Currency.minorUnitSymbol schema

ratioOfMinorUnitToMajorUnit.description: The ratio of the value of the minor unit to the major unit. For example, there are 100 cents to 1 dollar in the US; therefore, the ratio of the minor unit to the major unit is 100/1 = 100. If the currency does not have a minor unit, the attribute should have the value 1.
ratioOfMinorUnitToMajorUnit.title: Currency.ratioOfMinorUnitToMajorUnit schema
